thread.title: Cell C launches LTE, with cool deal
thread.title_full: Cell C launches LTE, with cool deal

author: Hadlee Simons
title: Cell C launches LTE, with cool deal
text:
Cell C launches LTE, with cool deal Article By: Hadlee Simons Wed, 23 Sep 2015 5:10 PM Share The Cell C logo. 
Cell C has announced the launch of LTE services in Gauteng and KwaZulu-Natal. 
The company said the launch comes after a R2-billion investment in LTE coverage for 2015, adding that a further R6-billion will be invested over the next two years to expand coverage in the two provinces. 
In the Western Cape? Then you can expect to find LTE before the end of the year. 
"The Western Cape rollout has been pushed forward and will have 200 LTE sites live before the festive season kicks off," the network said in a statement . 
The operator also announced a great deal for early adopters. 
"As part of its official launch, Cell C will offer 1000 customers in Gauteng and 500 customers in KZN the chance to buy 100GB of data, valid for three months, at only R100," it revealed. 
"This deal will be available exclusively at its Walk-In Customer Care Centre at its head office in Buccleuch, Johannesburg and KZN regional office in Umhlanga." 
The promotion is limited to one SIM per user and kicks off on October 1. Read More
